meanings.definition: A quantity having direction as well as magnitude, especially as determining the position of one point in space relative to another.
meanings.sent1: The explorer followed the vector on the map to reach the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent2: The GPS uses vectors to show the direction and distance to the destination.
meanings.sent3: The vector on the compass pointed towards the North Pole, but the explorer wanted to go south.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a strong vector that guided her towards achieving her goals.
meanings.sent5: The vector of his ambition propelled him to great success.

meanings.definition: An organism, typically a biting insect or tick, that transmits a disease or parasite from one animal or plant to another.
meanings.sent1: The mosquito acted as a vector for the malaria parasite.
meanings.sent2: The tick was identified as the vector responsible for spreading the disease.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky mosquito played the role of a disease-carrying vector in the jungle.
meanings.sent4: The pesky fly served as a vector for the contagious illness.
meanings.sent5: The tiny flea was the vector that transmitted the virus to the entire colony.

meanings.definition: A quantity having both magnitude and direction, represented by an arrow whose length represents the magnitude and whose direction represents the direction of the quantity.
meanings.sent1: The physics student drew a vector to show the force acting on the object.
meanings.sent2: The wind speed and direction can be represented by a vector arrow.
meanings.sent3: The playful child drew a vector in the sand, pretending it was a magical spell.
meanings.sent4: The artist used a vector to symbolize the flow of time in her painting.
meanings.sent5: The vector on the graph illustrated the relationship between speed and time.
